comment: I made an A in both his 1101 and 1102 classes. He's a little boring but very clear and very helpful. The quizzes suck and he makes it look like they weigh a lot on the syllabus but I had a failing grade in quizzes but made A's on all of my papers. Grades papers tough but fair according to a specific rubric. Lets you write about whatever you want.

This is his first year teaching an 1102 and it shows. He's very unclear when giving directions. 3 papers that all connect. Feels like your doing the same paper 3 times. Cancels class often. He does daily quizes that you basically have to memorize the text to understand. He is an OKAY proffesor.
His class is boring but it's a pretty easy class. There are two six page papers and one ten page...make sure you take your paper to the writing center!
he's a nice guy. attending class is mandatory but half the time he cancels it  or releases you within 10 minutes. you don't really do a lot and the class is pretty easy
Really great guy. If you do what you are supposed to do, this class with be awesome for you. :]

Very clear on what he expects. Papers are graded fairly, takes on several points for papers not meeting length requirements. Cancels class fairly often. Complete all assignments and participate in dicussions during class. Great Class!

The previous ratings miss-led me greatly. This professor is not that great at all. The amount of work he requires in his 1101 class is more than most 1102 class. While he is a nice guy in person, avoid taking his class at all cost.

Good Class. Professor is very laid back and he cancelled class three times the semester. There are a lot of quizzes and reading assignments so buy the books! There are three papers. The first one is 6 pages, second is 6 pages, and third is 10 pages and related to your major. My advice: Got ot he writing center before turning in your paper!

He speaks in a mono-tone voice but if you engage in the class and participate in the round table discussions it is very interesting. If you don't participate you will be very bored. He is extremely helpful. You must read the assignments though to pass the quizzes. I liked his class.

He is really boring, lectures are very dry. It's an extremely easy class, you only write 3 papers the whole semester and the longest one is only 10 pages. Straight forward on what to do for class, not many quizzes... it's so boring but an easy A.

WOW. these comments are interesting... Yeah, he's pretty boring for the most part..and monotone. but he's still an easy professor to have. Yes, you do need to read for the 5point quizzes, but you know what to read and the syllabus tells you the dates of everything. Easy A. Nice guy. GO to class, it's college. what do you expect. oh.&participate.
Hendricks is an extremely boring professor. His paper assignments are interesting, but very long. Try to find another professor with a passion for writing and helping students want to learn.

Class is pretty boring, but make sure to go because he has a lot of random 5 point quizzes sometimes. There's only 3 papers throughout the semester & he always gives you more than enough time to finish it. & he's always open to conference or help.

Very dry when he lectures, so don't expect an exciting class. But he puts everything on WebCT with concise instructions so there's no excuse for failing his class. He's also willing to conference with anyone who needs help. The papers are challenging, but he gives you ample preparation time. Just don't expect them to be graded for a few weeks.

Very dry when he lectures, so don't expect an exciting environment. But he puts everything on WebCT with very concise instructions so there is no reason anyone should fail his class other than just not caring. He is also willing to conference with anyone who needs help. He's a good professor, just don't expect your papers to be graded quickly.
